eu.davidea.flexibleadapter

Class AnimatorAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
      • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.SelectableAdapter
        • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.AnimatorAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastScroller.AdapterInterface, FastScroller.BubbleTextCreator, FastScroller.OnScrollStateChangeListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexibleAdapter

    public abstract class AnimatorAdapter
extends SelectableAdapter
    This class is responsible to animate items. Bounded items are animated initially and also when user starts to scroll the list.

    Animations can be customized for each items applying different logic based on item position and beyond.

    This class is extended by FlexibleAdapter.
    Since:
    10/01/2016 Created
    30/01/2016 Class now extends SelectableAdapter
    13/09/2016 animateView(RecyclerView.ViewHolder, int) is now automatically called
    07/12/2017 Reverse scrolling is independent from Forward scrolling
    See Also:
    FlexibleAdapter, SelectableAdapter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  AnimatorAdapter.AnimatorAdapterDataObserver
      Observer Class responsible to skip animation when items are notified to avoid double animation with RecyclerView.ItemAnimator.
      private static class  AnimatorAdapter.AnimatorEnum 
      private class  AnimatorAdapter.HelperAnimatorListener
      Helper Class to clear Animators List used to avoid multiple Item animation on same position when fling.

    • Method Detail

      • setScrollAnimate

        void setScrollAnimate(boolean animate)
        Parameters:
        animate - true to notify this Adapter that initialization is started and so animate items, false to inform that the operation is complete
        Since:
        5.0.0-b6

      • setAnimationInitialDelay

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationInitialDelay(long initialDelay)
        Sets the initial delay for the first item animation.

        Default value is 0ms.

        Parameters:
        initialDelay - any non negative delay
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • setAnimationDelay

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationDelay(long delay)
        Sets the step delay between an animation and the next to be added to the initial delay.

        The delay is added on top of the previous delay.

        Default value is 100ms.
        Parameters:
        delay - any positive delay
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • setAnimationEntryStep

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationEntryStep(boolean entryStep)
        If initial loading animation should use step delay between an item animation and the next. When false, all items are animated with no delay.

        Better to disable when using Grid layouts.

        Default value is true.
        Parameters:
        entryStep - true to enable step delay, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained since 5.0.0-b8

      • setAnimationDuration

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration of the animation for ALL items.

        Default value is 300ms.

        Parameters:
        duration - any positive time
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • setAnimationInterpolator

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationInterpolator(@NonNull
                                                android.view.animation.Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets a custom interpolator for ALL items.

        Default value is LinearInterpolator.

        Parameters:
        interpolator - any valid non null interpolator
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained

      • setAnimationOnForwardScrolling

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationOnForwardScrolling(boolean enabled)
        Enables/Disables item animation while forward scrolling and on loading.
        Enabling forward scrolling will disable onlyEntryAnimation.
        Forward scrolling is independent from reverse scrolling.

        Default value is false.

        Note: Loading animation can only be performed if the Adapter is initialized with some items using the constructor.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable item animation on forward scrolling, false to disable.
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        setOnlyEntryAnimation(boolean), setAnimationOnReverseScrolling(boolean)

      • isAnimationOnForwardScrollingEnabled

        public boolean isAnimationOnForwardScrollingEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if items are animated when forward scrolling, false only forward
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • setAnimationOnReverseScrolling

        public AnimatorAdapter setAnimationOnReverseScrolling(boolean enabled)
        Enables/Disables reverse scrolling animation.
        Reverse scrolling is independent from forward scrolling.

        Default value is false (only forward).

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable item animation on reverse scrolling, false to disable.
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        setOnlyEntryAnimation(boolean), setAnimationOnForwardScrolling(boolean)

      • isAnimationOnReverseScrollingEnabled

        public boolean isAnimationOnReverseScrollingEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if items are animated when reverse scrolling, false only forward
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • isOnlyEntryAnimation

        public boolean isOnlyEntryAnimation()
        Returns:
        true if the scrolling animation will occur only at startup until the screen is filled with the items, false animation will be performed when scrolling too.
        Since:
        5.0.0-b8

      • setOnlyEntryAnimation

        public AnimatorAdapter setOnlyEntryAnimation(boolean enabled)
        Performs only entry animation during the initial loading. Stops the animation after the last visible item in the RecyclerView has been animated.

        Note: Loading animation can only be performed if the Adapter is initialized with some items using the Constructor.

        Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to perform only entry animation, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this AnimatorAdapter, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        5.0.0-b8
        See Also:
        setAnimationOnForwardScrolling(boolean)

      • cancelExistingAnimation

        private void cancelExistingAnimation(int hashCode)
        Cancels any existing animations for given View. Useful when fling.

      • isScrollableHeaderOrFooter

        public abstract boolean isScrollableHeaderOrFooter(int position)
        Checks if at the provided position, the item is a Header or Footer.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if it's a scrollable item
        Since:
        5.0.0-rc1

      • animateView

        protected final void animateView(androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder,
                                 int position)
        Performs checks to scroll animate the itemView and in case, it animates the view.

        Note: If you have to change at runtime the LayoutManager and add Scrollable Headers too, consider to add them in post, using a delay >= 0, otherwise scroll animations on all items will not start correctly.

        Parameters:
        holder - the ViewHolder just bound
        position - the current item position
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • calculateAnimationDelay

        private long calculateAnimationDelay(androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder,
                                     int position)
        Parameters:
        position - the position just bound
        Returns:
        the delay in milliseconds after which, the animation for next ItemView should start.
